props.label: B.X.1 Payment risks between the state and plans
props.hint: Describe service-specific or other focused PI activities that the state conducted during the past year in this managed care program.</br>Examples include analyses focused on use of long-term services and supports (LTSS) or prescription drugs or activities that focused on specific payment issues to identify, address, and prevent fraud, waste or abuse. Consider data analytics, reviews of under/overutilization, and other activities.

props.label: B.X.2 Contract standard for overpayments
props.hint: Does the state allow plans to retain overpayments, require the return of overpayments, or has established a hybrid system? Select one.

choices.name: bpi-2-o2
choices.label: State requires the return of overpayments

choices.name: bpi-2-o3
choices.label: State has established a hybrid system

props.label: B.X.3 Contract locations of overpayment standard
props.hint: Describe where the overpayment standard in the previous indicator is located in plan contracts, as required by 42 CFR 438.608(d)(1)(i).

props.label: B.X.4 Description of overpayment contract standard
props.hint: Briefly describe the overpayment standard (for example, details on whether the state allows plans to retain overpayments, requires the plans to return overpayments, or administers a hybrid system) selected in indicator B.X.2.

props.label: B.X.5 State overpayment reporting monitoring
props.hint: Describe how the state monitors plan performance in reporting overpayments to the state, e.g. does the state track compliance with this requirement and/or timeliness of reporting?</br>The regulations at 438.604(a)(7), 608(a)(2) and 608(a)(3) require plan reporting to the state on various overpayment pieces (whether annually or promptly). This indicator is asking the state how it monitors that reporting.

props.label: B.X.6 Changes in beneficiary circumstances
props.hint: Describe how the state ensures timely and accurate reconciliation of enrollment files between the state and plans to ensure appropriate payments for enrollees experiencing a change in status (e.g., incarcerated, deceased, switching plans).

props.label: B.X.7a Changes in provider circumstances: Monitoring plans
props.hint: Does the state monitor whether plans report provider “for cause” terminations in a timely manner under 42 CFR 438.608(a)(4)? Select one.

props.label: B.X.8a Federal database checks: Excluded person or entities
props.hint: During the state's federal database checks, did the state find any person or entity excluded? Select one.</br>Consistent with the requirements at 42 CFR 455.436 and 438.602, the State must confirm the identity and determine the exclusion status of the MCO, PIHP, PAHP, PCCM or PCCM entity, any subcontractor, as well as any person with an ownership or control interest, or who is an agent or managing employee of the MCO, PIHP, PAHP, PCCM or PCCM entity through routine checks of Federal databases.

props.label: B.X.9a Website posting of 5 percent or more ownership control
props.hint: Does the state posts on its website the names of individuals and entities with 5% or more ownership or control interest in MCOs, PIHPs, PAHPs, PCCMs and PCCM entities and subcontractors? Refer to §455.104 and required by 42 CFR 438.602(g)(3)

props.label: B.X.10 Periodic audits
props.hint: If the state conducted any audits during the contract year to determine the accuracy, truthfulness, and completeness of the encounter and financial data submitted by the plans, what is the link(s) to the audit results? Refer to 42 CFR 438.602(e)
